Job Highlights Come to join our Market Data Analytics and Modelling team! Welcoming Data Scientist and Predictive Analyst to join us! Balanced working culture and great career growth opportunity! Job Description Company Description At Informa Tech, we believe that technology innovation is key to driving positive change in our society. We believe that digital inclusion underpins progress. And we believe that diversity in tech is central to a thriving industry. Our aim is to inspire the global technology community to build a better world by informing, educating and connecting them through world-class research, training, events, and media.  We sit at the heart of the tech community with specialisms in emerging tech/AI, enterprise IT, cyber security, service providers/NextG, critical communications, media & entertainment and marketing technology.   Leveraging over 100 trusted brands, we offer an unrivalled global networking community and platform for technologists and innovators to be inspired and reach their full potential. Job Description This is an excellent opportunity for a highly numerate data analyst with strong analytical, statistical and project management skills to join Informa Tech’s centralised Market Forecasting team (within MDAM). As a Market Forecaster you will be using data and insight to build quantitative analysis and forecasting models across the telecoms, media, and technology (TMT) industries. You will be given an opportunity to develop and nurture your research skills in some of the most relevant issues affecting our clients. In addition, you will be expected to demonstrate initiative and a flexible yet organised approach to data analysis and forecasting process across a range of different industry segments and subject areas in response to changing market dynamics. For this role you will be expected to: Develop models using predictive analytics and other forecasting techniques for metrics such as subscribers, devices and access technologies in the TMT industry. Carry out research and provide detailed analysis of key metrics for trend analysis of market and technology developments. Work closely with industry analysts to understand market dynamics. Collaborate with data engineers to source, extract and transform data ready for data exploration and modelling Hypothesis testing and summarising key trends using BI tools Provide client support through timely and clear communication Assist in bespoke research projects Qualifications Key Skills and Competencies Essential 5+ years of experience in data modelling techniques and their application to solving business problems Analytical programming experience in Python/R as well as querying data using SQL Strong working knowledge of data visualisation tools like Power BI and Tableau Advanced Excel skills including a working knowledge of VBA Ability to communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders Highly analytical, data-driven and detail oriented Relevant degree in computer science, business, economics, statistics or mathematics-based degree Strong understanding and awareness of the influence of economic factors on market development Desirable Knowledge of the telecoms and media industries Data science applications in predictive modelling and data mining Knowledge of producing written research on topics such as trend analysis, forecasting assumptions and methodologies Experience of working with Alteryx, AWS Glue & Athena Additional information We know that sometimes the 'perfect candidate' doesn't exist, and that people can be put off applying for a job if they don't fit all the requirements. If you're excited about working for us and have most of the skills or experience we're looking for, please go ahead and apply. You could be just what we need! Additional Information Career Level Senior Manager Qualification Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree Years of Experience 5 years Job Type Full-Time Job Specializations Sciences, Actuarial/Statistics

Job Highlights SEEK is listed in the Top 20 Most Innovative Companies by Forbes Work with a group of hard-working, fun and caring people! Genuine work-life balance and flexible working hours Job Description The Role Finance Data and Analytics  Drive the Finance data & analytics evolution, providing subject matter expertise and thought leadership based on a deep knowledge of business needs, industry trends, best practices and emerging products and services to bring value to the stakeholders. Define, own and deploy roadmaps for data and reporting services, driving adoption and ensuring delivery fits into org wide enterprise roadmaps and architectural platforms. Develop and deliver solutions for high impact business opportunities: Be the liaison when enhancements are requested to address identified gaps/needs; lead discussions to consider alternatives, consider cost/benefit analysis, recommend process improvement and technical solutions Ensure timely and accurate data models that provide meaningful management information and insights Understand complex business requirements and translate into model updates Lead sprint grooming, planning, review, and phases of the software development life cycle (SDLC), including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, deployment, integration, and documentation. Grow teams with specialized knowledge/system/tool capabilities, training team members and championing the use of technology across Seek Asia. Finance Systems Operations/Support Support, administer and deploy changes (model, dashboards, reports) as required. Support stakeholders in Finance on finance closing activities as well as the Planning and Analysis lifecycle. Troubleshoot existing data models and identify areas of improvement. Maintain process & solution documentation related to Anaplan. Stakeholder Management Build and maintain effective and constructive working relationships in a matrixed environment with a range of internal and external stakeholders, comfortably working up, down and across the organisation to "socialise" outcomes before final decisions are made. Clearly articulate well-reasoned and factually supported views or the case for change with the appropriate presence and engagement in Finance team forums. Challenge the status quo and present perspectives even in the face of strong contrary opinion to secure the trust and respect of finance peers and management in Asia. Key Relationships Reports to: SEEK Asia Head of Finance Excellence and Technology Other Key Relationships: SEEK Head of Finance Excellence Group & ANZ SEEK Finance Excellence ANZ and Asia team members SEEK Asia Finance team members Technology peers (Architecture, Data and Applications) Finance Systems and Data vendors  So, what are we looking for? The successful candidate will have:- Minimum 8 years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, EPM, data science or related field Direct hands-on experience with at least two of the following technologies: Anaplan, Oracle EPM, Power BI and AWS data warehousing/processing. Good knowledge of accounting standards and foundation of accounting or FP&A. Familiar with at least one programming language, e.g. Python, Java, C++, R and experience in database modelling and management. Experience with data visualization such as PowerBI etc Hands-on experience with BI visualization & reporting tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau) Bachelor’s Degree in Finance/IT/Business Systems or equivalent. Awareness and strong desire to proactively explore the capabilities of new technologies with interest in Machine Learning and convergence of data and AI. Ability to work under pressure, independently, managing multiple stakeholders, initiatives and tasks effectively. Brings a growth mindset, with a proven abilty to drive change and challenge the status quo Desired Values Believe in aiming high to deliver world-class results and yet, not forgetting to care for others. Passionate in people development. Agile and highly adaptable to constant changes. Ability to toggle between strategic and operational details and drive the agenda for both. Cross cultural awareness. Preference for those who have lived and worked in SEEK Asia markets. Embraces diversity and inclusion in both thought and action. Additional information At SEEK, the health and safety of our people is our highest priority. For this reason, SEEK has introduced a policy requiring all employees and visitors to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 within our offices, unless a formal medical exemption applies. In addition, all employees attending in-person work related meetings or events outside the office will also need to be fully vaccinated.  We have chosen to share this information early in our hiring process, so that candidates can make an informed choice. On this basis, as part of the application process you will be asked to confirm that you have read and understood this policy, and would like to continue with the hiring process.  Further details about this policy will be shared during the hiring process, as required. Additional Information Career Level Manager Qualification Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree Years of Experience 8 years Job Type Full-Time Job Specializations Computer/Information Technology, IT-Software

Job Description Job Summary: The Data Analyst - Gross Margin is a critical role on the Change management team. The role will provide comprehensive review of Product Gross Margin comparing quoted margin to actual margin and reporting cause and action to correct low margins. The position will complete in-depth variance analysis on all components of Gross Margin. This will require working with various functional support groups within the organization. Duties and Responsibilities: ·      Provide comprehensive review and reporting gross margins. ·      Provide in-depth variance analysis on all components of gross margin. This will require working with various functional support groups within the organization. ·      Prepare weekly reports to all production plants identifying low performing products with cause and recommended actions to each plant ·      Gather and update information to support the preparation of the monthly GM analysis. ·      Drive productivity enhancements via automation and data gathering process improvements. ·      Support various ad hoc change analysis requests, as directed. ·      Identify and drive opportunities to improve the financial performance of the business. ·      Drive financial and operational process improvement initiatives ·      Fulfilling such duties and responsibilities and comply with such Company rules and policies as the Company may designate from time to time and as are consistent with your Position. ·      Using your best efforts to promote the interests of the Company. ·      Performing other responsibilities that would customarily be performed within the scope of your Position, as directed by your manager Training: Develop and provide training for change analysts to gather and review data for GM, claims and inventory management. Job Highlights Fast-paced environment Join a high performing team Enjoy a fair work-life balance Job Description Responsibilities: The Technical Data Analyst serves as an analytics specialist in the Group Internal Audit Department (GIAD), focusing on the management of data from various sources and providing data-driven insights to relevant departments. In this position, the Data Analyst gains exposure to almost all departments within AmBank Group. Details of responsibilities are, as follows: Write data extract routines to support audit activities performed by the Internal Audit team Use data analysis tools to automate audit testing and develop techniques for continuous auditing and analyzing large volumes of data Interact with management and business partners to identify appropriate data sources and data elements required for analytics Perform data validation on extracted data. Ensure that appropriate action is taken by the various divisions and branches to correct reported deficiencies, irregularities and non-compliance and institute follow-up action where appropriate Keeps abreast and takes cognizance of current developments in audit techniques and technologies, laws and regulations affecting the operations of the Group. Assist in conducting special investigations and other special assignments by as directed by the Group Chief Internal Auditor by providing data analytics inputs. Assists in the preparation of data analytics report and relevant information for presentation to the Audit and Examination Committee (AEC) meeting.  Requirements: Education: The Data Analyst has to have a bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science / Information Technology / Economics / Information Systems / Statistics / Applied Math / Business Administration, or any other related field. An equivalent of the same in working experience is also acceptable. Experience: A candidate for this position must have had at least 2 years of relevant, data related business experience. The candidate must also have had a proven and successful understanding of how to interpret a business’s needs and how to draw these needs from analysis or raw information and data. A suitable candidate will demonstrate skill in SQL and preferably proven skills and experience working with at least one other major databases platform for example, DB2, Server, Sybase, Oracle, etc. A suitable candidate will also have substantial experience working with various data mining techniques and database structures. Communication Skills: Both written and verbal communication skills are imperative for this position. The Data Analyst plays a highly collaborative position where the staff works closely with key personnel within the Internal Audit Department, these are Audit Heads, Manager, and stakeholders who depend on his insights to make informed decisions and formulate solutions. Computer Skills/Ms Office/Software: A suitable candidate must demonstrate proficiency in the use of Ms Word, Ms Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook, which will be necessary for the creation of visually engaging reports and presentations. Analytical Skills: The candidate for the Data Analyst position must have strong analytical skills and have an ability to manipulate and analyze raw information/data, come up with conclusions.  The candidate will additionally have knowledge and skill in statistical measures such as sample sizing, correlations, and so forth. Interpersonal Skills: A candidate for this position must be comfortable working in a group setting and have good and innovative problem solving skills, be self-motivated and proactive, have an insatiable thirst for knowledge, have a passion for data collection and organization, have high attention to detail, be able to work on multiple simultaneous tasks prioritize and meet deadlines, and have an ability to maintain composure in uncertain and stressful times. Job Description Earthworm Foundation           Earthworm Foundation is an international dynamic non-profit organization that helps companies transform their supply chains across the world for the benefit of people and nature.  Earthworm Foundation is seeking a motivated  Landscape Programme Data and GIS AnalystBased in Malaysia  We are seeking a candidate with experience in data management and analysis, in particular of supply chain and environmental data, and with excellent communication and writing skills. The candidate will play a central role in conducting and organising data analysis – both spatial and non-spatial – for the EF Landscape Programme, ensuring alignment and continuity across landscape teams. To be effective in these capacities, this role will require strong and effective inter-departmental collaboration skills. The ideal candidate is passionate about leveraging supply chains to improve environmental and social outcomes and interested in a career with a dynamic non-profit that builds relationships with companies, governments and civil society organizations to bring responsible products to market. About Earthworm Foundation  Earthworm Foundation currently has a presence in 16 countries including Indonesia, Malaysia, Ecuador, Peru, Brazil, India, and several locations within West Africa, Europe and the Americas. We employ more than 200 people worldwide and work with big and small companies, communities and producers of raw materials to create compelling cases of transformation. With an innovative and entrepreneurial spirit, we work on the ground with people to create inspiring transformation stories. We focus on creating value, engaging without judging and carrying hope and a positive vision of the future.  What Makes Us Unique  We see the world through interactions and relationships. Operating between two worlds (NGO-Companies/Buyer-Supplier), we encourage our partners to look inside, and are not only their environmental conscience. In addition to traceability and assessments, we create and innovate solutions to the challenges companies and communities face.  What We Offer ·         A unique work experience in a dynamic non-profit directly impacting the conservation of the environment and improvements in human rights and social equity through supply chains.     An organic environment with the chance to work in a multicultural team with passionate people. The opportunity to lead complex projects, build customer relationships and develop new business, with exposure to different tasks. Responsibilities and Scope  In direct collaboration with the Global Head of Landscapes, the essential responsibilities and functions of the Landscape Programme Data and GIS Analyst include:  Globally coordinate data analysis for the landscape programme·         Generate standardized guidelines and templates for spatial and non-spatial data analysis to ensure that all landscape teams work in a consistent way, using the same approaches. Work with the other relevant teams in EF to align on methodologies and guidelines for data analysis, ensuring consistency across the organisation.  Perform analysis and manage data for the landscape programme·         Perform data analysis that meets the needs of the landscape programme. This includes generating data outputs for business development and strategic planning.       Manage and keep up to date relevant data outputs from the landscape programme, ensuring data is stored in such a way as being accessible to all landscape teams.  Manage a supply chain connection database for the landscape programme Manage a supply chain connection database of suppliers connected to EF client companies within the boundaries of all landscapes. The database should have an interface that allows EF client companies to see how many suppliers their members are connected to in each landscape. The database should be updated twice per year. Generate data-generated reports for landscapes·         Generate quarterly alert reports for relevant landscapes. The report should be based on monitoring data from both desktop and field-based monitoring tools managed by EF. Using the supply chain connection database and alert reports, supply chain profiles for landscape financial supporters should be generated that highlight how these data points link to the supply chain of the relevant financial supporters.  Requirements – Candidate Profile Minimum Qualifications·         Bachelor degree, or other equivalent higher level training in data management, supply chains, environmental management, GIS or another related field·         3-5 years of relevant professional working experience ·         Ability to understand and interpret complex data sets linked to complex, unstable scenarios·         Ability to think creatively and build user-friendly templates, tools and presentations·         Intermediate to advanced Excel skills·         Advanced data management & data analysis skills·         Experience with supply chain data (especially palm and pulp and paper supply chains)·         Experience with handling complex and often incomplete data sets·         Experience with working across multiple cultures & time zones·         Intermediate to advanced GIS skills (using ARCGIS) Language skills:·         English proficiency Personal characteristics:·         Passion for working on issues related to sustainability, resilience, and supply chains.·         Hands-on, practical, innovative.·         Flexibility, takes initiative/proactive and positive attitude.·         Ability to work within a multidisciplinary and multicultural team.·         Ability to handle multiple tasks and work autonomously.·         Committed to Earthworm Foundation values:    Focus on action and on-the-ground results; Entrepreneurial spirit; Client-focused; Open collaboration and communication; Humble; Respect for each other.  Working conditions / Physical effort: Based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia·         Must be able to do remote work/work from home when required.  Other information:         Full-time position·         Valid work authorization for country  Successful candidates will be contacted by email for an initial interview. Only candidates who send a full application will be considered. Only selected candidates will be contacted.  Additional Information Career Level Senior Executive Qualification Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma Years of Experience 3 years Job Type Full-Time Job Specializations Sciences, Geology/Geophysics

Job Description Our regional Customer Data Management Analysts are the guardians of National Instruments account, territory, and resource data assets across our many systems like Oracle, Data Warehouse, and SFDC by adhering to business rules, best practices and representing the regional needs of their stakeholders to reduce operational friction, enable decision making on enterprise investments and represent the needs of sales data stakeholders.  Become an integral part of creating an exceptional data, governance & operations ecosystem by joining the Global Sales Operations team as a S Senior APAC Customer Data Management Analyst. Position: Senior APAC Customer Data Management Analyst Team: APAC Customer Data Management Team (CDM) Department: Global Sales Operations Report to: Customer Data Management Senior Group Manager, APAC Location: Penang, Malaysia Our regional Customer Data Management Analysts are the guardians of National Instruments account, territory, and resource data assets across our many systems like Oracle, Data Warehouse, and SFDC by adhering to business rules, best practices and representing the regional needs of their stakeholders to reduce operational friction, enable decision making on enterprise investments and represent the needs of sales data stakeholders. They are also relied on to partner with stakeholders to proactively create and maintain our data to enable enterprise processes and drive sales processes like coverage and compensation. This role also influences future requirements for improvements to our customer data models as well as ensure compliance with data governance policies and resolution of data quality issues. They are key members of the Global Sales Operations team and have an opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment highly collaborative environment. As a Senior Customer Data Management Analyst, you will apply knowledge of data policy and analysis and act as a subject matter expert across Global Operations, Sales, Support and Services to support master data strategy and ensure enterprise master data accuracy, integration, and value optimization. You will act as a mentor and advisor to the team to solving real-world data problems and identifying improvement opportunities with critical importance to the business and team. You will apply knowledge in SQL and build Tableau dashboard for data quality check, workload and SLA monitoring and propose to management on action as needed. This role expects a mixed distribution of time between daily operation task and data quality oversight. Core Job Responsibilities: Daily Operations Task Accountable to maintain high benchmark and adherence on customer data governance policies, standard stewardship procedures, best business practices, user guides, and other necessary training and job aid materials. Serve as a subject matter expert (SME) and ensure professional support for account hierarchies, customer data integration linkages, account territories, reporting and overall governance operations whenever data conflicts arise. Participate in and drive global efforts relating to process calibration, policy adherence, task prioritization, on-time delivery, problem solving and knowledge sharing. Collaborate with different functional teams to recommend changes related to account setup and maintenance to improve process efficiencies. Data Quality Oversight Accountable to develop business rule, conduct appropriate data analysis using SQL and create Tableau dashboard to review and audit data elements. Advise Customer Master Data Manager on related master data issues, identify corrective action items, continuous improvements of the process and provide inputs to developing Data Governance roadmaps and strategies. Setting up data quality framework and matrices across the different task scopes to provide visibility and insight on data quality and policy adherence Lead and work on regional and global improvement projects and partner with other areas of Global Sales Operations to leverage data to drive key sales processes Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree or higher and at least 5 years of experience in master data management / data analysis and/or business process management Ability and willingness to work on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of multiple identifiable factors. Demonstrate good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions and manage risk. Network with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise Ability and willingness to maintain functional and technical knowledge across multiple data platforms and tools, and provide feedback and recommendations to IT and Data Teams across the enterprise Ability and willingness to drive change and improvement of Governance policies practices and procedures. Prior experience with sales operations, territories, quotes, order management and other customer datasets preferred Experienced in ERP and CRM systems such as Salesforce and Oracle Excellent analytical and technical skills with demonstrable knowledge in SQL, Tableau, data lake, data quality tool Process orientation, detail focused, ability to multi-task Demonstrated track record of strong leadership and project management skills, people management and/or coaching experience is a plus Additional Information Career Level Junior Executive Qualification Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree Years of Experience 3 years Job Type Full-Time Job Specializations Sciences, Actuarial/Statistics

Job Description HR Systems and Data Analyst Superstar required for one of the UK's fastest-growing MSPs to join our team based in Cyberjaya, Malaysia  Location: Cyberjaya, Malaysia  Salary & Allowances – Competitive salary (inclusive monthly allowance, plus benefits)  Nasstar - About Us  Nasstar is a managed service specialist. We deliver an integrated suite of services from cloud computing to networking and communication solutions to provide businesses with greater flexibility and efficiencies. Through strategic consultation to implementation and management, we provide the vision and the mechanics needed to create transformational change for our clients.  Nasstar is the business and technology partner that delivers IT without drama.  We stop IT from ever becoming a problem. We manage and protect your systems. We support your employees and help service your customers. And we identify opportunities to help migrate your applications and infrastructure into multi-cloud environments, keeping your costs down and your productivity up. And we do it without you even noticing us. Leaving you free to get back to what you do best – driving business value.With Nasstar, your IT just works. Details of our businesses and our outstanding achievements so far can be found on our websites: https://www.nasstar.com/https://www.modalitysystems.com/  About the Role:  The HR Systems and Data Analyst takes ownership of our people-related systems to ensure data is kept in an accurate, efficient, organized, consistent, secure, compliant and easily accessible way. They take this data and analyze trends, patterns and gaps, in order to provide meaningful analysis and insights that can drive improvements in performance and employee experience  Main Responsibilities: People-Related Systems Design process flows, data requirements for people-related systems such as the HR Information System (HRIS), Learning Management System (LMS), Applicant Tracking System (ATS). Automate tasks and reduce human intervention wherever possible through people-related systems. Provide engaging and relevant training and reference materials to system users at various levels. Maintain relationships with providers and monitor the effective performance of systems. Reporting and Data Insights Create, analyze and regularly deliver insightful reports including but not limited to recruitment, starter, leaver, employee satisfaction, diversity, absence. Provide ad hoc people reporting and data analysis as required across the business. Undertake market analysis and benchmarking as required.  HR Operations  As part of the HR Operations and Reward team Take an active role in the HR Operations and Reward team, getting involved in other departmental activities. Take part in improvement projects across the wider HR team.  What we’d like from you: Bachelor’s degree or substantial additional working experience CIPD certifications  Working experience in the IT/Telecoms industry is highly desirable Solid experience as an administrator or coordinator in a fast-paced environment Substantial experience operating an HRIS, Learning Management System, Applicant Tracking System or Payroll system Experience in delivering meaningful reporting and analysis Experience arranging onboarding and induction activities Experience in delivering training or developing training guides Working in the IT/Telecoms industry Supporting the implementation of / adhering to ISO and other standards of accreditation Salary/reward benchmarking Highly organized and highly accurate with attention to detail Highly analytical Excellent systems skills, including Excel etc for manipulation of data Curious and data-driven  If you think you have what it takes to become part of Team Nasstar, then don’t hesitate to apply now! What you can expect from us in return At Nasstar, we think it’s important to look after our employees. In addition to a competitive salary, supportive teams, and a real chance to progress your career, we offer a range of benefits which include: Holiday: 20 days’ holiday, plus bank holidays Medical Insurance Enrollment: Will take place after probation is passed Top tech: We don’t just keep our services and solutions for our customers. That means best-of-breed software and hardware for all our staff Shift, Travel & Parking Allowance: RM 950 allowance per month Overtime: All staff are eligible for overtime (if required) Training: Comprehensive induction and training plan to ensure you have all of the necessary skills to be successful Office Location & Environment: Working in a modern new office with good facilities in the immediate location  Why choose a career with Nasstar? At Nasstar, we have several goals. We’re one of the UK’s fastest-growing MSPs and want to continue to keep growing. We’re a leading Converged ICT Services Provider and want to keep expanding our product portfolio and customer base. But most importantly of all, we want to continue to provide the very best technological solutions to our customers in order to help them achieve digital transformation. And underpinning this is more than 700 talented professionals whose hard work is recognized and rewarded accordingly. Nasstar recognizes the importance in creating an environment that supports personal development to enable individuals to reach their full potential. With so many varied roles across the company, an excellent Apprenticeship Scheme, and various training and development programmes available, at Nasstar the opportunities for growth are endless. A note for agencies Nasstar has a world-class, in-house Recruitment Team that work hard to successfully find the very best candidates. Therefore, unfortunately, we cannot accept any agency submissions for any of our roles. Job Description Job Summary Must Have Skillsets:  Business Intelligence (BI) dashboard development using Power BI and/or Apache Superset. Development and integration of best-in-class front-end web applications in close collaboration with internal and external stakeholders for research and analysis of big data: hands-on experience using front-end frameworks and languages such as React, Angular, VUE, Laravel PHP, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to design and to build responsive web applications is required.  Geospatial visualization and development experience using frameworks and tools such as React-Leaflet, FME, ArcGIS, Google Maps, and QGIS is a plus.  Application development and prototyping experience using frameworks and tools such as React Native, Swift, Java, Expo, AWS Amplify, Firebase, and Azure App Services to cater for multiple platforms including iOS and Android mobile application is a plus. Data pipeline development experience using framework and tools such as Apache NiFi, and Talend, including proficiency in RESTful / SOAP API, GraphQL, JSON and XML for API integration is a plus.  On-premises, hybrid, or cloud infrastructure development experience such as Hadoop Stack, Cloudera, Snowflake, AWS, GCP, or Azure is a plus.  Security devops experience to manage and operate optimal security posture: prevent, detect, respond, and remediate end-to-end security of data and IT assets is a plus. Develop and transform high-level architecture into low-level design and implementation. Perform unit and integration testing on all developed codes.  Any other task assigned by management related to data analytics and IT.  Job Requirements  Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering or relevant specialization.  3-5 years of relevant experience (web and mobile development, big data analytics etc).  To carry out the development and integration of best-in-class front-end web and mobile applications in close collaboration with internal and external stakeholders for research and analysis of big data. Job Description  Earthworm Foundation   Earthworm Foundation (EF) is an international and dynamic non-profit organization (NGO), which helps companies transform their supply chains across the world for the benefit of people and nature.   EF is seeking a motivated: Sustainability Data Analyst based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to join our Supply Chain Analysis (SCA) team. The candidate will play a critical function in developing and improving data files and data processes, being part of a global team working to address environmental issues in supply chains, such as deforestation related to Palm Oil. The candidate should possess experience on data management, and excellent critical thinking, problem solving, organisational and analytical skills. The ideal candidate is deeply passionate about leveraging supply chains to improve environmental and social outcomes, and interested in a career with a dynamic non-profit that builds relationships with companies, governments and civil society organizations to bring responsible products to market. About Earthworm Foundation Earthworm Foundation currently has presence in more than 16 countries including Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, India, Ecuador, Peru, Brazil, Ghana, Ivory Coast, and several locations within Europe and the Americas. We employ more than 200 people worldwide and work with big and small companies, communities and producers of raw materials, to transform practices in global supply chains. With an innovative and entrepreneurial spirit, we work on the ground with people to create inspiring transformation stories. We focus on creating value, engage without judging and carry hope and a positive vision of the future. What Makes Us Unique Beyond providing advice on policy set up based on our strong technical expertise, we see the world through interactions and relationships. Operating between two worlds (NGO-Companies/Buyer-Supplier), we encourage our partners to look inside, and are not only their environmental conscience. In addition to traceability and assessments, we create and innovate solutions to the challenges companies and communities face. What We Offer ·        A unique work experience in a dynamic non-profit directly impacting the conservation of the environment and improvements in human rights and social equity through supply chains. ·        The opportunity to lead complex projects, build customer relationships and develop new business, with exposure to different tasks. ·        An organic environment with the chance to work in a multicultural team. Responsibilities and Scope Data structure & management ·        Lead the maintenance and improvements of the structure of files needed for the team to guide our members on their efforts to achieve No Deforestation Verification (NDV) ·        Lead the maintenance and improvements of the structure of files used to exchange data between Earthworm and Airbus, backbone of our Starling satellite monitoring system. ·        Contribute to the design, implementation and maintenance of Earthworm Supply Chain teams’ database Process and methodology documents ·        Lead the maintenance and improvements of the internal Methodology documents related to the reports process and data management within the SCA Team Product development & Continuous improvement ·        Support the SCA Team lead on finding creative solutions to new problems, developing new products or services to tackle environmental or social challenges within the supply chains of Earthworm members. ·        Review and continuously improve the files & processes required for data analysis, to maximise data sharing & minimize double work across teams. Find areas for improvement, and lead brainstorming discussions. ·        Lead the design and implementation of a new tracking system to monitor the evolution of deforestation alerts investigation ·        Lead the design and implementation of improved member dashboards, for Earthworm members to better visualize their data in a central location and better guide their actions with regards to responsible sourcing Data quality control ·        Quality Control of Starling webportal (functionalities, data available, analytics, etc) Requirements – Candidate Profile Minimum Qualifications ·        3-5 years’ relevant professional working experience related to data management ·        Bachelor degree or other equivalent higher-level training in data management, supply chains, environmental management, or another related field; ·        Able to understand and interpret complex data sets linked to complex, unstable scenarios; ·        Ability to think creatively and build user-friendly templates, tools and presentations; ·        Advanced Excel skills (including VBA); ·        Advanced data management & data analysis skills; ·        Experience with supply chains is a good asset; ·        Experience with handling complex and often incomplete data sets; ·        Experience with working across multiple cultures & time zones; ·      Committed to Earthworm Foundation values. Language skills ·        Fluency in English (written & spoken). Working conditions / Physical effort ·        Role lead by Malaysian team in Kuala Lumpur, but location open to any other EF office; ·        Office-based position (must be able to do remote work/work from home when required); ·        Some local travel to company offices; Other information ·        12-months contract; ·        Full-time position; ·        Legal authorisation to work in an EF office. To Apply Interested candidates are invited to send a cover letter and CV. The position will be open until filled. Only selected candidates will be contacted.  Additional Information Career Level Senior Executive Qualification Not Specified Years of Experience 3 years Job Type Full-Time Job Specializations Others, Others

Company Description  At Western Digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible.  At our core, Western Digital is a company of problem solvers. People achieve extraordinary things given the right technology. For decades, we’ve been doing just that. Our technology helped people put a man on the moon.  We are a key partner to some of the largest and highest growth organizations in the world. From energizing the most competitive gaming platforms, to enabling systems to make cities safer and cars smarter and more connected, to powering the data centers behind many of the world’s biggest companies and public cloud, Western Digital is fueling a brighter, smarter future.  Binge-watch any shows, use social media or shop online lately? You’ll find Western Digital supporting the storage infrastructure behind many of these platforms. And, that flash memory card that captures and preserves your most precious moments? That’s us, too.  We offer an expansive portfolio of technologies, storage devices and platforms for business and consumers alike. Our data-centric solutions are comprised of the Western Digital®, G-Technology™, SanDisk® and WD® brands.  Today’s exceptional challenges require your unique skills. It’s You & Western Digital. Together, we’re the next BIG thing in data. We offer an opportunity to learn about all aspects of our fashion e-commerce business and support data-driven decision-making as well as a deep dive into the work of our Data team. You will be conducting research and data analysis of specific features which our team plans to develop. Where possible, you will be in charge of your own assignment with the guidance of Zalora Lead Data Scientist. This role is based in Malaysia.  Responsibilities: Monitor and troubleshoot daily ETL load for data accuracy, availability and issues Actively participate in design and implementation of different data projects Deliver Tableau dashboards and automate reporting solutions to enhance user visibility of business operations Enhance data dictionary and documentation of existing data for better understanding and self-service of internal users Requirement: A fresh graduate with a background in computer science or data analytics Good programming skills in Python, SQL, Tableau Working knowledge of cloud service platforms, either AWS or GCP, and other code management tools in GIT/Airflow etc. Troubleshoot different data-related issues and collaborate on ETL/BI development and enhancement tasks A good team player and motivated to learn and grow in a fast-paced e-commerce environment Able to commit full-time for 6 months The ZALORA Story  ZALORA is Asia’s leading online fashion, beauty and lifestyle destination, part of Global Fashion Group. As one of the region’s pioneer large scale ecommerce platforms, ZALORA has established a strong presence throughout the region, particularly in Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei, the Philippines, Hong Kong, and in Taiwan, enjoying over 50 million visits per month.  ZALORA is not obligated to accept resumes from any third parties on behalf of potential candidates for any position (advertised or otherwise) by any means, unless ZALORA has executed a written agreement with such third party and has expressly requested such third party for candidate referrals. Third parties who provide unsolicited resumes of candidate(s) shall waive and forfeit all rights to claim for any placement fees or referral fees in the event that such candidate is eventually engaged or employed by Zalora or Global Fashion Group.

Global Fashion Group (GFG) is the leading fashion and lifestyle retail destination in Asia Pacific, Latin America, and CIS. We connect over 10,000 global, local, and own brands to a market of more than one billion consumers through four established e-commerce platforms: THE ICONIC, ZALORA, dafiti and lamoda. Through an inspiring and seamless customer experience enabled by our own technology ecosystem and operational infrastructure, we are dedicated to being the #1 fashion and lifestyle destination in our markets. With 17 offices and 10 fulfilment centres across four continents, GFG proudly employs a dynamic and diverse team with deep local knowledge and expertise. In 2019, GFG delivered more than 34 million orders to over 13 million Active Customers.  ABOUT THE DATA TEAM  Our vision to bring affordable and sustainable fashion to customers in our markets is powered by technology and data. The GFG Data Team is an integral part of GFG and is essential to enabling a data-driven decision-making culture. You will work across various departments ranging from Category Management (Buying & Planning), Finance, Customer Service, Marketing to Fulfilment delivering unique insights about our business, customers, and marketplace. It is an exciting place to be with opportunities for professional growth and the ability to work in an international team. You’ll be reporting into the Head of Business Intelligence and work with counterparts in Singapore and Vietnam.  ABOUT THE ROLE  As a Senior Data Analyst, you will apply your passion for Data Analysis to play across the spectrum of data engineering, data science and translation of insights to English. You create relevant data models, cultivate, and cleanse data and use data analytics platforms to present meaningful dashboards and insights to the business.  THE IMPACT YOU’LL MAKE  In this role you will:  Work closely with business areas to translate business strategy / goals into data-based deliverables through the development of data models that generate relevant insights Partner with the business to plan data projects / requests Define the approach to extract and manipulate large volumes of data using database / datawarehouse and cloud technologies, develop ELT processes where relevant Source, collate, manipulate, and interrogate datasets from disparate sources to ensure validity, accuracy, and completeness using programming languages as required Use platforms (Tableau, AWS QuickSight, Google Data Studio, Power BI) for analytics and visualisation Develop dashboards and insights reports for the business Clearly convey findings / recommendations to stakeholders Run periodic and ad-hoc reporting as planned WHAT WILL YOU BRING TO THE TEAM  You will have experience producing data insight presentations and reports, managing analytics projects, and extracting data from various sources. You have built your expertise in data mining, data analytics and statistical modelling that include proficiency in programming languages (Python, R) and BI platforms (Tableau, AWS QuickSight, Google Data Studio, Power BI) as well as database and datawarehouse technologies and cloud technologies to an expert level. Your ability to work with a range of technical and non-technical stakeholders to projects to specification in the agreed timeframes will help us provide a seamless customer experience to the business.  EXPERIENCE AND MINDSET TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE REQUIRES  BS/MS in Computer Science or related technical discipline. 4+ years proficiency in any of the following programming languages: Python, R. 4+ years of proficiency in any of the following BI platforms: Tableau, AWS QuickSight, Google Data Studio, Power BI. 4+ years of Experience with database and datawarehouse technologies. Demonstrable knowledge and experience in data mining, data analytics and statistical modelling of large data sets. Experience with AWS or GCP cloud technologies. Strong presentation and visualisation skills. Business acumen to turn data into insights that are relevant. Strong organisational skills resulting in effective delivery to deadlines. Good written and oral communication skills in English. 4+ years stakeholder management. WHAT WE OFFER YOU  The unique opportunity to have a serious impact on a growing organisation. A dynamic working environment shaping the face of fashion e-commerce in growth markets. Significant career growth opportunities in a fast-growing business, gain working exposure in the 20+ countries across the group. Work closely with a global talent pool with international mindset .   Apply today and join GFG in this exciting role shaping the face of fashion e-commerce!   Global Fashion Group embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We comply with all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements.

Data Analyst, Full Time  Location Bayan Lepas, Pulau Pinang, Malaysia  Why You’ll Love Cisco  Everything is converging on the Internet, making networked connections more relevant than ever before in our lives. Our employees' revolutionary ideas impact everything imaginable - from entertainment, retail, healthcare, and education, to public and private sectors, smart cities, smart cars, and everyday devices in our homes.Here, that means you'll take creative ideas from the drawing board to powerful solutions that have real world impact.You'll interface with Cisco leaders, partner with experienced mentors, and develop incredible relationships with colleagues who share your interest in connecting the unconnected.You'll be part a team that cares about its customers, enjoys having fun, and you'll take part in changing the lives of those in our local communities.Come prepared to be inspired.  Team Description  You will be part of Cisco’s Global Manufacturing Engineering team in Supply Chain’s Global Manufacturing & Logistics organization. The team incubates, experiments, develops, deploys and embraces Security, Test and Manufacturing technologies & frameworks by sensing & partnering with internal partners. The team will look into applying industry-leading technology capabilities and best methodologies to deliver on Quality, Operational Efficiency, Security, and Scalability across Cisco’s global manufacturing operations.  What You’ll Do  TheData Analystrole will have the responsibility for delivering business value from data. This is achieved by analysing data, presenting data insights and reports with business technical application, developing data led improvements to manufacturing and test processes, translating business needs and requirements into predictive analysis, functionalities and software specifications while driving true value to our customers. Develop optimum and efficient data analysis methodologies including rule-based and logical decisions for engineering work processes to be optimized & effective Drive & collaborate with technical specialists on data analytics development that support efficiency, quality initiatives and projects Lead and support data science and data analysis related projects which analyses sophisticated problems, pattern matching, anomalies and translates data into useful insights to drive business and operational decisions in various areas such as Manufacturing, Assembly and Test that improves manufacturing quality, improves yield, reduces deviations, improves manufacturing cycle time, reduces cost, extends manufacturing capabilities, etc. Draw from a broad background of data-mining techniques in mathematics, statistics, information technology, machine learning, data engineering, visualization, etc. to discover insightful patterns in the dataset Work with various scientific data such as equipment sensor data and logs, image and various types of signals, manufacturing process data, etc. to extract meaningful information for analytics Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports. Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources from Supply Chain and Engineering. Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.  Qualifications Recent Graduate or Minimum 1 year work experience in an analytical role or relevant working experience Minimum bachelor’s degree in Applied Science/Applied Mathematics/Econometrics/Actuarial Science or relevant degrees with a strong focus on statistics or data Strong background in statistical concepts and calculations Knowledge in Null hypothesis, t-test, Spearman/Pearson correlation, Bayesian Statistics etc Innovative and strong analytical and algorithmic problem solvers with excellent troubleshooting/debugging skills Impeccable attention to detail and strong discipline in cross checking results Eagerness to contribute in a team-oriented environment Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment Excellent written and verbal English communication skills Must be Malaysian citizen (student visa's or visa's obtained on your own are not applicable)  Preferred Skills Experience in MongoDB, Snowflakes, TensorFlow, Pytorch Knowledge in Python’s data analysis packages Pandas, Numpy, Scipy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, Seaborn or equivalent tools like R, SAS, and SPSS. Data engineering experience, including SQL and experience manipulating structured and unstructured data sources for analysis Experience in handling real data  Why Cisco  #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.  We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!  But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)  Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.  So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

This will include Solution Architectures, ETL, data migration, Data Governance, among others. Ensure our Practice operating model is effective from a Data-perspective, which includes capabilities and partnerships to delivery and technology, to design and deliver customer solutions. This includes leveraging and interlocking with Maxis internal IT led Advanced Analytics Teams where applicable. Support cloud data engineering sales where necessary. This includes enabling the sales teams and presales teams to be able to win opportunities by designing solutions per customer needs both in terms of pain-points and expected outcomes. Evangelise our Data offerings and services to our customers and assist in business development especially during the start up phase of this practice. Skills / Knowledge Creation and QA of AWS/Azure Solution Architectures highly desirable. Responding to bids and tenders. Job Description  Nielsen is building talent pipelines to meet future hiring demand. This is a pipeline role. If your background matches our requirements, we’ll follow up with an exploratory conversation.  Responsibilities Execute sample design, data validation, universe estimation, universe update, and panel sample design, as per the plan and with no quality escapes for the assigned country/ countries. Learn and utilize the global tools to ensure standardization of process Work with Input Operations in the deployment of their tools Contribute to the enhancement of the country/ cluster through various planned initiatives/ activities Develop expertise on the base product, the processes, and tools Contribute to creating best practices for the country/ cluster/ region and sharing them with other GDDC centers Engage with SMEs on new methodology and new tools Be actively engaged and participate in engagement activities of the team About You  You’ve dabbled in data. You’ve perused Python or R. And you have the communication chops to translate it all into conversation or presentations. While you’ve worked with global cross-functional teams, you can also put your head down and focus on independent projects. Seeing the big picture takes attention to detail. Keeping up with the fast-changing world of digital media measurement takes someone who recognizes that. You know what’s happening in big data and you’re ready to influence what’s next.  Qualifications Fresh Graduates are encouraged to apply Candidate from Statistics, Operations Research, or Econometrics with outstanding analytical expertise will be an ideal Domain expertise in at least one area: Demography, Sampling, Statistics Modeling, Survey Design Practices. Proficient in Python, R, SAS, SPSS, or other statistical packages. Knowledge of SQL, working with Algorithms, and large-scale databases (added advantage) Working knowledge with data visualization tools (e.g. Spotfire, Tableau, etc.) and mapping tools would be plus Working knowledge with collaboration tools like Atlassian, Git, Bitbucket, and Confluence would be a plus Experience in some of the statistical modeling, variance estimation, trend analyses, indirect estimation, data aggregation techniques, automation, generalization. 1-2 years of work experience in the survey research industry with hands-on experience in developing and executing survey research methodologies (Not a must) About NielsenIQ  Additional Information  NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.  NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.  Microsoft aspires to help our customers achieve their own digital transformation, leveraging the power of Microsoft Cloud solutions and support offerings. To this end, Microsoft invests in a dedicated Customer Success team that will help Microsoft customers successfully realize their business outcomes.  Azure is the most comprehensive, innovative and flexible cloud platform today and Microsoft is hiring professionals that will drive customer cloud adoption within the most important companies in the market.  We are always learning. Insatiably curious. We lean into uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from our mistakes. We build on each other’s ideas because we are better together. We stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve and are motivated every day to empower others to do more and achieve more through our technology and innovation. Together we make a difference. This is a customer facing role where will be focused on the Microsoft Azure Data Platform in collaboration with customers and the Microsoft field in the Enterprise account segment of our business. You will own technical customer engagements in the data space including architectural design sessions, proof of concepts, performance optimization, and blocker escalations. The ideal candidate will have experience in customer-facing roles and success leading end to end technical engagements in the data space.  Responsibilities Understand customers’ overall data estate Business and IT priorities and success measures to design data solutions that drive business value. Ensure long term technical viability and optimization of production deployments, and lead and advise on migration and modernization using key Azure Data services such as: Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance, SQL Server on Virtual Machines, etc Apply technical knowledge to architect solutions that meet business and IT needs, create Data Platform, AA/AI roadmaps, and ensure long term technical viability of new deployments, infusing key analytics technologies where appropriate (e.g. Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Azure Data Explorer, Power BI etc.) Work with multiple customers to implement POCs/MVPs, guide customers through to production deployment, operationalization, troubleshooting, and optimization of their production deployments , resolve blocker escalations, provide technical recommendations and architecture design Ensure customer deployments and solutions exhibit high levels of performance, security, scalability, maintainability, and reliability for new and existing deployments Working across multiple pillars of Data & AI - RDBMS, NoSQL, Analytics, AI Identify and build technical collateral or technical assets that helps the Microsoft field accelerate Azure consumption Serve as the technical lead and interface between Azure field teams and Engineering, share best practices and insights to drive product improvement Develop deep relationships with key customer decision makers (both Business and IT) who drive long-term innovation and data platform adoption within their company to enable them to be Azure data advocates Be an Azure Platform evangelist with customers, partners and external communities. Qualifications  Technical  Expertise: Enterprise-scale technical experience and depth with one or more areas of the Azure data platform (Azure SQL - Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance, SQL Server on Virtual Machines, or equivalent) (required) Hands-on experience with relational and NoSQL databases (Azure or equivalent) with knowledge of key differentiation to determine best fit for use cases and applications Knowledge of SQL on premise and/or ARC-enabled Data services Knowledge of AKS (Azure Kubernetes Service), Container and related services (ie. LNetworking, Storage, Registry, Security, Monitoring, Linux OS etc) Knowledge and understanding of all pillars of Data & AI - Data (RDBMS, NoSQL), and Analytics Hands on experience creating data solutions for customers  that lead to production deployments, and optimization of those deployments Breadth of technical experience and knowledge (preferred): Application development skills, scripting, deployment automation Performance tuning and optimization High availability / disaster recovery Relational database migrations across SQL Server and OSS database technologies, modernization from on-prem to the cloud Experience working with structured and unstructured data in Big Data scenarios using technologies such as SQL Data Warehouse, Snowflake, Big Query, Redshift and data lake concepts Database architecture Debugging DB related issues Production level expertise, preferably in a services or product engineering role Competitive Landscape: Knowledge of data platforms such as AWS, GCP, Oracle, IBM, Snowflake, etc. 7+ years working with large Enterprise customers and field communities in consulting or similar roles, leading deployment projects, architecture, design, implementation of Data or Analytics based solutions OR: 7+ years of experience in building products and services as part of Engineering teams in engineering positions (required) Professional Expertise: Problem Solving. Ability to solve customer’s data problems through various cloud technologies (required) Relationship Building. Proven track record of building deep technical relationships with senior executives. Experience in managing various stakeholder relationships to get consensus on solution/projects. The ability to influence and build relationships across technical and business teams (required) Good business acumen to quickly understand the customer’s industry and business to have relevant discussions with business decision makers. Collaboration and Communication. Acknowledged for driving decisions collaboratively, ability to communicate data concepts effectively with business and technical audiences, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through with exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Ability to orchestrate, lead, and influence virtual teams, ensuring successful implementation of customer projects. Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences (Senior Executives, IT Management, Data Engineers) (required) Education Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Technology or related field preferred Experience Prior work experience in a Consulting/Architecture position within a software and/or services company such as Amazon, Google, IBM, etc. desired Prior solution delivery or engineering experience Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. About Accenture  Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  About Seabury Consulting Cargo Advisory  Seabury Cargo Advisory is a practice area of Seabury Consulting, part of Accenture, and a leading advisor to the global air freight and broader transportation industry. The practice advises many of the world’s best performing airlines, shipping lines, integrators, forwarders, airports, leasing firms, etc. A dedicated data analytics and business intelligence team is responsible for providing leading industry databases to our clients, including comprehensive air and express cargo demand and supply databases and forecasts. The data analytics team operates from offices in Amsterdam and Kuala Lumpur and aims to provide top class customer service and continuously improve and innovate existing and new products to continue our steep growth curve.  About The Job  We are looking for exceptional and highly motivated data professionals to join the KL team to further grow our capabilities and expand our presence in APAC. The KL team is responsible for developing, maintaining, and managing Seabury’s market intelligence products.  As a Seabury analyst you work across the whole data analytics spectrum including data analysis, data modeling, machine learning, and database development. A particularly important aspect of the job is to keep our databases up to date and maintain the highest standards of data quality. To be successful in this role you need passion for data. You probably have a background as an analyst, developer or data scientist, however you may come from a different field with a strong emphasis on numerical analysis.  Experience from the industry is not essential however a strong desire to build knowledge about the aviation and transportation industries is a must. Most importantly you need to be forward thinking and pragmatic with a healthy curiosity for all things data.  The tight-knit team is focused on delivering high end results in a supportive and fun environment. You will develop your analytical, technical and communication skills as well as your industry knowledge. The learning curve will be steep but rewarding, and you will build a foundation of skills and experience which will prepare you for a range of more senior roles.  Responsibilities  Develop data products. Be part of our Agile development teams and further develop our products using technologies like Microsoft SQL Server, Azure, Python, R, and machine learning  Routinely identify outliers, implement corrections and benchmark against other data sources to ensure Seabury has accurate data for its clients  Keep up to date with current industry trends reported in various industry publications to ensure domain expertise with the data being analyzed  Desired Skills & Experience  Experienced analysts, with a minimum 1-2 years’ work experience in an analytical role  Essential experience in SQL  Minimum bachelor’s degree in Applied Science/Applied Mathematics/Economics/Business Administration/Business Information Systems, or relevant degrees with a strong focus on math or data  Highly self-motivated, self-directed, and attentive to detail  Experience from Microsoft SQL technology, including Azure, SSIS, and SSAS. Although we will consider candidates with experience from a different analytics stack  Excellent written and verbal English communication skills  Applicant must possess the right to employment in Malaysia  You will also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.
